comments.text:
Even as a non religious person I have to say how much it bothers me that 
those that oppose religion keep stating that the concept of Heaven/Hell is 
a reward/punishment system. It is not. Heaven is proximity to God (a 
relationship with Him) while Hell is distance from Him. Just like many 
things in the Bible, Heaven and Hell are described metaphorically since the 
literal is not possible to describe.

So if you're going to oppose religion, oppose it properly. Don't make up 
straw man arguments. Religion can be easily bashed for things it DOES 
believe in. No need to make up nonsense perspectives to bash.﻿
comments.author: Curtis Smale

comments.text:
Sadly that is true, even many religious people interpret Heaven/Hell as a 
reward/punishment system. But any analysis of the God of the Bible would 
show that His New Testament self is forgiving and loving and would not want 
to put someone in Hell. So this vengeful God interpretation is easily 
refuted by any smart Christian. And even a half decent Christian can easily 
point out that it is the choice of the person to follow or not, thus we'd 
be responsible for being sent to Hell, not God.

In any case, this silly "God hates people that don't enslave themselves to 
them" idea that atheists toss around like it's some realistically logical 
argument against religion are clearly as clouded in the brain as the 
religious people they insult, and it makes real atheists look bad. What's 
worse, is that most who claim to be atheist are those that oppose the 
Bible. It is fine to oppose the Bible, but the alternative is not 
necessarily atheism. There are many religions and many do not have a Heaven 
or Hell or judging God. So using the concept of Heaven and Hell as an 
anti-religion argument is pathetic as it only opposes a small number of 
world religions.
comments.author: Curtis Smale

comments.text:

comments.text:
+Siolfor80
*but they didn't start their campaigns in the name of atheism, only to 
assert their dominance.*

Actually Stalin was atheist from the start, the USSR was very much an 
atheist empire. Extraordinarily so, they just about eliminated the Orthodox 
church, hence all the schisms. It's only really come back in Russia 
recently as Putin is using it to shore up public opinion. Sort of creating 
a divine mandate to rule for himself.

*As for Hitler, I don't know why you guys even go there as evidence from 
confirmed documents and artifacts PROVE that he was a Christian*

Bullshit. He called Christians stupid repeatedly, he talked about how 
destructive the church was, he wrote up plans to remove it... He wasn't 
even a deist, he believed wholeheartedly in evolution, and that Germans had 
evolved beyond other people. Germans who aligned to his fashion values.

Hitler only had one religion... Nivea carefree: For when you need to look 
your best.

He acknowledged the power of the church, he noted that he needed to keep 
the church onside while he was grabbing power, but his personal writings, 
as in anything that wasn't going to be public, but... Well think of the 
church like Switzerland. Neutral during the war since they were too much 
effort to destroy beforehand, but they were going to go in his utopia.

*and had no problem at all manipulating other people (which Christians are 
STILL known to do)*

TIL Sociopathy == Christianity. Thank Cthulhu you're here to save us, 
whatever would psychologists have done without you. Incidentally ad 
hominens aren't evidence for anything except of your ability to debate, or 
more precisely the lack thereof.

*"Gott mit uns," means "God is with us," was written on all Nazi belt 
buckles.*

Which has been around since the Roman Empire, and was used in the German 
military since at least the times of the German Empire.

Remember that "Third Reich" part? Hitler was attempting to claim a direct 
line from the Holy Roman Empire to NAZI Germany, arguing that the Third 
Reich was a continuation of what was already there. Think Putin's ethnic 
Russians claim. "I'm not invading Ukraine, Ukraine was never a country in 
the first place".

That sort of crazy.

Now for a moment pretend you're not invested in this. The ad hominem would 
suggest otherwise, but note I never said you had to be good at pretending.

Say you're trying to claim that you're a continuation of two previous 
empires, and your military uses something which deeply offends you. Maybe 
the mascot is a non-manipulative Christian. Oh woe. Oh terror.

Now are you going to change old traditions? You're running on a party line 
of conservatism, traditionalism, of venerable military might and political 
right.

Why in all hells would you change a belt? It's going to annoy the Generals, 
it's going to annoy the masses. Sure you're happier but everyone else is 
starting to question this whole "Third Reich" thing and thinking maybe this 
is just a whole new Germany altogether.

See? Hitler wasn't stupid.

I mean he was fighting on fifty fucking fronts, but he was at the very 
least a savvy politician and possibly a humble person indeed who actually 
did care about his homeland. He knew that fucking with traditions would 
counter his traditionalism argument, he knew that ending the church would 
crush him once he lost the religious side,

And if we're quoting: "I'm sure that Nero didn't set fire to Rome. It was 
the Christian-Bolsheviks who did that, just as the Commune set fire to 
Paris in 1871 and the Communists set fire to the Reichstag in 1932."

Hitler saw Christians as stupid, mislead, brainwashed, ignorant, and also 
very, *very* dangerous and something he had to rely on till he was more 
secure in his power. And that meant keeping them on board during WWII.

WIth that in mind, thinking like a politician, knowing that every public 
statement is designed to keep as many people onboard as possible, go 
through your particular favourite evidence and critically question the idea 
of whether or not Hitler was a Christian or just a good politician.

comments.text:
+Jazzy Fizzle Christians try bringing religion back into schools, politics 
and law. They want to replace evolution class with religion class, yet they 
want taught only the stuff they believe in. Mormonism or Islam or any other 
religion should not be taught, of course. Allah, Ra, Zeus, Kami-no-Kaze, 
Shango and the thousands of gods that billions of people believe 
in...Christians are so full of themselves, they would kill in order to keep 
those things out of schools.

Religious people try shoving their wicked world view down the throats of 
everyone else while they demand respect from others.
Religion does not deserve any respect at all. I always insult religious 
people. Not because they disagree with me, but because of what they believe 
they know about reality and, more importantly, what they are doing with 
this knowledge. If religion was just that...a belief, I would have no 
problem giving you people all the respect you want, in the same way I 
respect someones dress-sense or the decor in their home. Even if I found it 
tasteless, I would respect them enough not to say so.

But religion is more than just belief. Religion wants to impose a universal 
morality, which is why it has always attracted the kind of person who 
thinks that other peoples private lives are their business. And giving 
respect to this mentality is exactly what got us into the mess we're in. 
We've given religion ideas above it's station and we've persuaded it that 
it's something it is not. When the truth is, faith is nothing more than the 
deliberate suspension of disbelief. It's an act of will! It's not a state 
of grace, it's a state of choice. Because without evidence, you've got no 
reason to believe, apart from your willingness to believe.

So, why is that worthy of respect any more than your willingness to poke 
yourself in the eye with a pencil? And why is faith considered some kind of 
virtue? Is it because it implies some depth of contemplation and insight? I 
don't think so. Faith, by definition, is unexamined...so, in that sense, it 
has to be among the shallowest of experiences. And yet, if it could, it 
would regulate every action, word and thought of every single person on 
this planet. Because let's not forget, even an impure thought is a sin!

Well, I think the belief in god is an impure thought. It pollutes our 
understanding of reality; it gets in the way! And it brings out the worst 
in the best of us. So that we're even prepared to stoop so low, as to 
poison the unformed minds of those we love the most - our children. By the 
time they're old enough to think for themselves, it's too late. They've 
been well and truly hypnotized.

I'm sorry, but there is no nice way to say this. If you fill your childs 
mind with images of Satan and the horrors of hellfire, you're a sick 
individual and you are mentally ill. And the only reason you don't know 
this, is because you've been indulged for far too long by people and 
institutions that really ought to know better. The truth is, your beliefs 
are infantile, your scriptures are lies and your gods are illusions. And I 
can say that will all due respect, because no respect is actually due! And 
besides, anyone who has to demand respect automatically deserves ridicule.

If god exists, I want him to tell me, not anyone else. And in case you're 
wondering, that includes you. So please, don't quote any more scripture at 
people, stop evangelizing others and stop scaring little children. I really 
can understand why people are drawn to scripture and religion. Because it's 
so easy. It's all laid out for you...all the thinking you ever need has 
already been done - you don't have to lift a single brain cell. How very 
convenient!

You Christians don't even have consensus with your fellow Christian friends 
about what is right and wrong...they all have different interpretations of 
the Bible. You try evangelizing non-believers by using scripture and 
apparently call them 'close minded' if they don't want to hear any of this. 
Now, being called close minded by religious people is a bit like being 
called yellow by a bunch of bananas.

I'm so close minded that I'm only prepared to engage with reality. I know 
it sounds unreasonable but when something isn't real, I find I got an 
in-built automatic prejudice. In fact, I'm so close minded when it comes to 
absurdities that, you won't believe this, I actually require proof. That's 
right, copper-bottomed proof, that would stand up in a court of law. A real 
court of law, not some fancy human rights commission. And I think we all 
know that your scripture is not gonna furnish that proof if you talk from 
now until the end of times.

Your deeply hold beliefs are just an accident of birth. The parents that 
you happen to be born to and the stuff they happen to believe in, is now 
doubtless the stuff that you believe in. Had you been born elsewhere, you'd 
believe other stuff, stuff that you would consider heretical and false. 
Yet, in both cases yours would be the only true religion. How are you not 
embarrassed?

Claiming that evolution and atheism are just other belief systems is like 
saying that 'off' is a TV channel, or 'bald' is a hair color. Atheists do 
not 'believe' in stuff anything other than maybe we believe that it will 
rain tomorrow. We know stuff. We know facts because they are proven to be 
true. Religion is not on par with science. It's not two sides of the same 
coin. Your scripture does not go on the same shelf as my science. Your 
stuff goes over there, on the shelf with Thor, Krishna, the Kraken and Orcs.

So no, thank you, I don't wanna hear about your beliefs and I don't give a 
damn what your scriptures have to say about anything. Sorry to be so close 
minded. I'm gonna spell it out for you as clear as I can, just to avoid any 
misunderstandings: I don't care if you've got a written formula for 
converting lead into gold. Keep it to yourself.

Evangelizing people who don't want to hear it is such a tasteless thing to 
do - it's like exposing yourself in public. Whatever happened to good 
manners? It's not that we don't even know the pitch...God knows we've heard 
it thousands and thousands of times and it doesn't get any more convincing 
in the telling, but that doesn't seem to register with you guys. If 
somebody tried to sell me a car and I decided I don't want one, I wouldn't 
expect that person to returning the next day and try to sell it to me 
again. Especially if it was an invisible car :)
You see, I'm not in the market for a car...any car. I decided to walk. 
That's gonna take me where I'm going because I'm going where it takes me 
and I'll be happy to get there. In fact, I already am.

I don't need to hear about anybodys god or saviour or prophet or scripture 
or any sort of supernatural hokuspokus voodoo mambo jambo or any fancy 
variation on that theme...half man, half god-kind of arrangements...I'm not 
interested. I've heard it all before and I think it's all lies; insulting, 
degrading nonsense that contaminates everything it touches. In fact, 
whenever I'm exposed to religion, I feel dirty. I feel contaminated by the 
vileness of the platitudes that are passed for wisdom. The naked 
moneygrabbing, the controlling rhetoric devoid of any humanity or 
compassion. Are you kidding me? The supercilious hectoring tone, the 
constant intrusive demands for privilege and the absolutely unforgivable 
violation of the minds of young children. I think the people who made a 
profession of religion are the scum of the earth and if Jesus turned up 
tomorrow, he would agree with me. So...let's hope he does.

And by the way, I think Jesus undoubedtly made it very clear that his 
followers should do as he did and walk the earth, do good and give all 
possessions to the poor. I would figure that only a tiny part of his 
"followers" are actually onto the quest.  Ask yourself, are you one of 
these "Christians" who are browsing YouTube on their high-tech computers, 
judging other people, telling them how your god will punish them? You are 
not a follower of Jesus. You are just a fan. Who'll end up in hell. So, see 
you there!
